preface.title: Overview
preface.para: The @@ProductName@@ @@RELEASE@@ release provides a template for providing Network Analyzer - Fiber (NA-F) features on the Customer Service Console platform. It renders the NA-F's dynamic content in the Service Management Platform (SMP)-based CSC console. With the template, a deployment team starts off with pre-built content that is ready to integrate with a NA-F installation and to run tests against that installation.

In addition, the system includes the @@FieldAppName@@, an Android application in which field technicians can receive jobs assigned via the CSC, and act on them to troubleshoot and provision hardware, as well as navigating directly to jobs.

The primary prerequisite software includes CSC, SMP, and the NA-F Data Sources. This guide addresses how to deploy the template in a CSC installation as well as how to configure and customize the template.Architecture diagram is from L2 sales presentation, (same diagram that was used in Test Strategy document. For original, see images/fttx_architecture.pptx

section.title: Using the CSC to send jobs to field technicians in the @@FieldAppName@@
section.para: The @@ProductName@@ connects CSRs and field technicians by allowing CSRs to create work orders in the CSC and assign them to field technicians. These work orders become jobs in the @@FieldAppName@@.

In the @@FieldAppName@@, a field technician sees a list of those jobs that are:
Assigned to him or her
Not closed
Either set with an appointment start time in the next 24 hours, or have no appointment time set.
For details on creating work orders, see Work order management in the Endpoints tab.
